intro: Sophoclesia cordifolia var. muscicola, commonly known as the Florida panhandle bluemontia, is a rare flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and produces showy, violet-blue flowers. The plant thrives in moist, acidic soils and is typically found in swampy or wetland habitats. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, which includes many bell-shaped flowers. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in several states.
